---
title: Bernoulli-logit (logistic) model
---

Model:

$$
\begin{align}
y_i \sim \text{Bernoulli}(\text{logit}^{-1}(\mu_i)) \\
\mu_i = \alpha + \beta \cdot x_i
\end{align}
$$

Parameters needing priors:

-   $\alpha$ (intercept)
-   $\beta$ (predictor weights)

Data:

-   $y$ (binary outcome)
-   $x$ (predictors)

### Prior on $\alpha$

[@boonstraDefaultPriorsIntercept2019a]

Exponential power distribution.

$$
p(\alpha) \propto \exp{-\abs{\alpha / \sqrt(2) \sigma}^\gamma}
$$


```stan
target += -fabs((alpha) / (sqrt(2.0) * alpha_scale))^(alpha_power);
```

$\sigma$ (`alpha_scale` in the Stan code) should be chosen by:

1. choose constant $0 \lt q \lt 1$ which is prior mass outside extreme
   boundaries. e.g. 0.01

2. calculate $s_n = \exp{-1 / (2n)}$, where $n$ is number of
   observations

3. select \sigma = \sigma_n such that $P(1 - s_n <
   \text{logit}^{-1}(\alpha) < s_n | \sigma = \sigma_n) = 1 - q.

This can be done with the following R functions:

```r
ep_sigma <- function(gamma, n, q) {

  s_n <- exp(-1 / (2 * n))

  root <- uniroot(
    \(sigma) pgamma(q = (qlogis(s_n) / (sqrt(2) * sigma))^gamma,
      shape = 1 / gamma, lower.tail = FALSE) - q,
    interval = c(0, 10))

  root$root
}
```


### Prior on $\beta$

Sparsity prior (RHS)

[@ghoshDefaultBayesianPriors2003]
